EN

We are looking for a Senior Python Engineer to join the jay project development team (Germany), which researches and develops state-of-the-art media technologies for film, television, and video streaming.
The work in the project will run for 3 months with the possibility of prolongation.
Tech Skills
5+ years of backend development experience with Python
Strong experience in RESTful API design and implementation
Solid knowledge of relational databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL)
Proficiency in graph databases (especially Amazon Neptune)
Experience with Bash scripting and automation
Proficiency with Git for version control
Familiarity with API authentication protocols (OAuth 2.0, API keys)
Strong skills in JSON/XML data parsing and transformation.
Domain-Specific Knowledge
Web: Django or FastAPI or Flask
Experience integrating with e-commerce marketplace APIs (e.g., Amazon SP-API, eBay, Shopify)
Understanding of inventory, order, and product data synchronization
Awareness of rate limits, webhooks, and data consistency challenges
Understanding multi-channel selling platforms and OMS (Order Management Systems)
Basic understanding of tax, shipping, and fulfillment workflows.
Architecture & DevOps
Experience with the AWS cloud platform (EC2, Lambda, S3, Neptune, etc.)
Understanding of CI/CD pipelines and DevOps best practices
Experience with Docker and Kubernetes for containerization and orchestration
Knowledge of message queues (e.g., SQS, RabbitMQ, ElasticSearch) and asynchronous processing
Ability to design scalable, fault-tolerant backend systems
Monitoring and logging experience with tools like CloudWatch, ELK, or Prometheus.
We Offer:
Work on a unique and innovative media-tech product
Flexible work format and scheduling
International, multicultural team.
About the Project:

Founded and based at the iconic film location Babelsberg, Transfermedia production services is researching and developing state-of-the-art media technologies for film, TV and streaming. In 2022, after years of research and development and with the support of an international tech investment company, Transfermedia launched jay ‚Äî a pioneering metadata technology for film. Our tech solution enables a whole new in-stream experience for audiences and creates novel business opportunities for broadcasters and VoD platforms. From infotainment to in-stream shopping.

We are seeking a talented Backend Software Engineer to join a team dedicated to building high-quality, scalable solutions. If you enjoy tackling complex challenges and working with cutting-edge tools, this position is for you.

Requirements:
Python for backend or infrastructure systems
Proven experience designing & operating automation systems for network or infrastructure environments
Familiarity with data-analytics platforms (Databricks, BigQuery, Splunk, ELK)
Hands-on work with time-series or telemetry data
Nice to Have:
Golang development experience
Solid grasp of scalable software design patterns
Understanding of security fundamentals for distributed systems
Exposure to capacity modeling, forecasting, or planning in cloud environments
Overlap time requirements:
10 AM‚Äì6 PM CET (12 PM‚Äì8 PM CET twice a week)
Working conditions and benefits:
Paid vacation, sick leave (without sickness list)
Official state holidays ‚Äî 11 days considered public holidays
Professional growth while attending challenging projects and the possibility to switch your role, master new technologies and skills with company support
Flexible working schedule: 8 hours per day, 40 hours per week
Personal Career Development Plan (CDP)
Employee support program (Discount, Care, Health, Legal compensation)
Paid external training, conferences, and professional certification that meets the company‚Äôs business goals
Internal workshops & seminars
Corporate library (Paper/E-books) and internal English classes.
Interested in this opportunity? Apply now!
